intro: Neochilenia setosiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered neochilenia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Neochilenia setosiflora is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its hairy leaves and floral structure are adaptations to its arid environment, helping to reduce water loss and attract specific pollinators.
